content:
• Tuesday, April 2, 2013
  • CALL

    More on magicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL): Q4 beats across the board on a 56% surge in total...

    More on magicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL): Q4 beats across the board on a 56% surge in total sales. Net revenue from the sales of magicJack and magicJack PLUS increased 88% to $19.1M. Access rights renewal revenue came in at $12M, an increase of 19% Y/Y, and accounted for 29% of total revenue. The company also announces some new additions to its board, appointing Richard Harris to its Board of Directors and Jose Gordo as Senior Vice President of Finance. Shares +14.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:46 PM
  • ET-OLD

    It's a busy day for tech IPO filings. Cloud marketing automation/analytics software vendor...

    It's a busy day for tech IPO filings. Cloud marketing automation/analytics software vendor Marketo has joined the fray, filing to raise $75M under the symbol MKTO. Marketo, which many have viewed as a possible Salesforce acquisition target, posted 2012 revenue of $58.4M (+80% Y/Y), and a net loss of $34.4M. Deferred revenue stood at $20.6M at year's end. Marketo competes with Oracle-acquired Eloqua, as well as e-mail marketing firms ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) and Responsys (NASDAQ:MKTG). (S-1)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM
  • ZOLT

    Zoltek (NASDAQ:ZOLT) trades higher in the post session on speculation the company is evaluating...

    Zoltek (NASDAQ:ZOLT) trades higher in the post session on speculation the company is evaluating strategic alternatives. Seeking Alpha contributor Neal Greenberg notes that Quinpario Partners turned up the heat last month on ZOLT's board to consider a cash infusion or even an all out takeover of the company, both of which were initially rejected out of hand. More recently however, he points out that Quinpario has filed an updated SC/13Da indicating ZOLT's board has reconsidered and agreed to open discussions. Shares +5.8% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +5.2% AH on news it will roll out two real-money gambling titles,...

    Zynga (NASDAQ:ZNGA) +5.2% AH on news it will roll out two real-money gambling titles, ZyngaPlusPoker and ZyngaPlusCasino, in the U.K. later this week. That's a little ahead of a prior ETA of June. The games, which are launching in partnership with U.K. firm bwin.party, will initially be available only on the Web and via download - no Facebook or mobile offerings for now. Separately, the WSJ observes Zynga mobile title/Wheel of Fortune knockoff What's the Phrase has made it into the App Store's top-10 rankings.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM | 3 Comments
  • CALL

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CALL +17%. NVAX +6%. ZOLT +6%. NFX +5%. ZNGA +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: CALL +17%. NVAX +6%. ZOLT +6%. NFX +5%. ZNGA +5%.
    After-hours top losers: KOS -10%. GPN -6%. VOD -4%. SEP -4%. OXM -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • VZ

    Verizon (NYSE:VZ) doesn't "currently have any intention to merge with or make an offer for...

    Verizon (NYSE:VZ) doesn't "currently have any intention to merge with or make an offer for Vodafone (NASDAQ:VOD), whether alone or in conjunction with others," the telco announces, addressing an FT report about a possible joint bid with AT&T (NYSE:T). Verizon does reiterate it "would be a willing purchaser" of Vodafone's 45% stake in Verizon Wireless, but that's pretty well-known. VOD -3.9% AH. VZ -0.8%. T -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 5 Comments
  • ARCC

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) announces a 16.65M share public offering, with an additional option...

    Ares Capital (NASDAQ:ARCC) announces a 16.65M share public offering, with an additional option to purchase up to an additional 2,497,500 shares. The company expects to use the net proceeds to repay part of its debt facility, as well as other general corporate purposes, including investing in its portfolio companies. Shares -2.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFX

    Newfield Exploration (NYSE:NFX) +4.2% AH after announcing a significant discovery offshore...

    Newfield Exploration (NYSE:NFX) +4.2% AH after announcing a significant discovery offshore Malaysia, where a well encountered 1,585 ft. of net natural gas pay and a stem test confirmed commerciality of the reservoir. It's "the largest conventional exploratory success Newfield has made in its 25-year history," CEO Lee Boothby says.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • SEP

    Spectra Energy Partners (NYSE:SEP) -4% AH after announcing a public offering of 4.5M common...

    Spectra Energy Partners (NYSE:SEP) -4% AH after announcing a public offering of 4.5M common units. SEP intends to use the net proceeds for funding capital expenditures and acquisitions.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ATML

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) -3% AH after announcing CFO Stephen Cumming has resigned. Steve Skaggs,...

    Atmel (NASDAQ:ATML) -3% AH after announcing CFO Stephen Cumming has resigned. Steve Skaggs, Atmel's SVP of corporate strategy, has been named interim CFO, and a search has begun for a full-time replacement. Atmel is also raising its Q1 revenue guidance range to $318M-$328M from a prior $311M-$328M; the consensus stands at $320.7M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • CALL

    MagicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL): Q4 EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.40. Revenue of $41.4M (+56% Y/Y)...

    MagicJack VocalTec (NASDAQ:CALL): Q4 EPS of $0.91 beats by $0.40. Revenue of $41.4M (+56% Y/Y) beats by $n2.39M. Shares +9.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM
  • OXM

    Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q4 EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $236.2M (+18% Y/Y)...

    Oxford Industries (NYSE:OXM): Q4 EPS of $0.65 misses by $0.04. Revenue of $236.2M (+18% Y/Y) beats by $7.56M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • LHCG

    LHC Group (LHCG +3.5%) hit a new 52-week high today after the company said it has acquired the...

    LHC Group (LHCG +3.5%) hit a new 52-week high today after the company said it has acquired the assets of Infirmary Hospice Care in Alabama. The acquisition forms part of LHCG's strategy of acquiring hospice providers within it's home health markets. LHC owns 34 hospice locations in 10 states. The Alabama facility generates annual revenue of about $2.5M, and will continue to operate under the name Infirmary Hospice Care through 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (JNPR -1.5%), Allot (ALLT -1.4%), Procera (PKT -1.9%), and BroadSoft (BSFT -0.1%) close...

    Juniper (JNPR -1.5%), Allot (ALLT -1.4%), Procera (PKT -1.9%), and BroadSoft (BSFT -0.1%) close lower after Pac Crest's Brent Bracelin cuts his estimates, citing European macro concerns. Though Pac Crest's research suggests the world's 15 biggest carriers (outside of China) could increase capex by 10% this year, it also indicates over half of the growth is expected to come from European carriers, and "there still appears to be a gap between talk and placing orders." Bracelin sees Cisco (CSCO - only 30% of revenue from carriers) as relatively insulated. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:01 PM
  • BWEN

    Shares of Broadwind Energy (BWEN +7.9%) are surging on news of a $14M order for towers from a...

    Shares of Broadwind Energy (BWEN +7.9%) are surging on news of a $14M order for towers from a U.S. wind turbine manufacturer. BWEN will produce the towers in its Abilene, Tex., facility with delivery scheduled for H2 2013. BWEN has announced $127M in tower orders in recent months, and says the Abilene plant is near capacity for 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU +7.8%), which posted small gains early in the session after announcing a...

    Immunomedics (IMMU +7.8%), which posted small gains early in the session after announcing a $16.7M arbitration settlement yesterday, rose sharply midday after SA contributor PropThink said the company's cash position now comfortably exceeds 2013's expected cash burn. Tuesday morning's modest gains allowed "investors to make an entrance without paying up for the improved balance sheet," PropThink said. 

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • CHK

    As Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.1%) plans some spring cleaning of its portfolio with the hopes of...

    As Chesapeake Energy (CHK -2.1%) plans some spring cleaning of its portfolio with the hopes of raising $4B-$7B this year, Wells Fargo analysts say CHK’s 20% stake in Chaparral Energy is probably worth ~$280M, which would represent a nice gain from the $178M paid in 2006. Much of the proceeds CHK hopes to raise are expected to come from various small assets, and Chaparral seems to fit the bill.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • X

    BAML analysts expect U.S. Steel (X -5.8%) to see its margins squeezed as iron ore prices fall...

    BAML analysts expect U.S. Steel (X -5.8%) to see its margins squeezed as iron ore prices fall and costs remain fixed, so the firm cuts its earnings estimates and price target to $14. Shares hit a new 52-week low at $17.60 and are -26% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • PWR

    Quanta Services (PWR -3.3%) slips after announcing earlier that its founder and executiove...

    Quanta Services (PWR -3.3%) slips after announcing earlier that its founder and executiove chairman, John R. Colson, will retire as executive chairman of the board of directors on May 23. The Board will appoint a replacement following the annual stockholders' meeting.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • VLO

    Valero (VLO -6%) says proposed new rules aimed at reducing sulfur content in gasoline would cost...

    Valero (VLO -6%) says proposed new rules aimed at reducing sulfur content in gasoline would cost it hundreds of millions of dollars in equipment construction and upgrades alone. In addition to spending $300M-$400M initially to implement the rule, VLO also predicts operating costs would rise by an undetermined amount every year due to the rules proposed Friday by the EPA. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 53 Comments
  • AFFY

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY -7.4%) gets no love from Piper Jaffray's Ian Somaiya today, saying that with...

    Affymax (OTC:AFFY -7.4%) gets no love from Piper Jaffray's Ian Somaiya today, saying that with Omontys off the market, the company could run out of money much sooner than anticipated. The company currently has $67M in cash, but is burdened with over $50M in outstanding liabilities as of the end of February. This capital burn has the company running out of cash as early as the second-quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • GG

    Gold futures fell $25 to settle at $1,575.90/oz., near four-week lows, as strength in the dollar...

    Gold futures fell $25 to settle at $1,575.90/oz., near four-week lows, as strength in the dollar and rallying U.S. equities has wiped out gains logged when Cyprus began to hit the headlines. Mining stocks such as Goldcorp (GG -2.8%), Barrick (ABX -2.2%), Kinross (KGC -4.3%) and Newmont (NEM -3.7%) are down in tandem with gold prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 9 Comments
  • EDAP

    Shares of Edap (EDAP -5.2%) take a hit after its Q4 missed on top line estimates. Earlier today...

    Shares of Edap (EDAP -5.2%) take a hit after its Q4 missed on top line estimates. Earlier today the company reported a loss of €0.06 or $0.08 per share, in line with the Street consensus for a loss of $0.08 loss per share. Revenues were €9.4M, or $12.3M, slightly beating estimates of $12.15M. In the same period last year, the company reported an EPS loss of €0.04 or $0.05 on revenues of €7.5M or $10.1M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • IRIX

    Iridex (IRIX -0.9%) slips today, shrugging off upbeat news posted earlier that it's entered into...

    Iridex (IRIX -0.9%) slips today, shrugging off upbeat news posted earlier that it's entered into a global distribution and supply agreement with Peregrine Surgical, a privately held company based out of Pennslvania. Under the agreement, IRIX will become a worldwide distributor for Peregrine labeled products and Peregrine Surgical will become part of IRIX's supply chain for the manufacture of certain products.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:44 PM
  • SVM

    The SEC reportedly is investigating Silvercorp Metals (SVM -9.2%) and has issued a subpoena...

    The SEC reportedly is investigating Silvercorp Metals (SVM -9.2%) and has issued a subpoena requesting all documentation relating to the miner’s long-running battle with short sellers. SVM has denied any wrongdoing, but the subpoena, issued March 15, is the first indication U.S. securities regulators are actively investigating the Canadian company.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 3 Comments
  • VLO

    Shares of refiners are taking a beating today, apparently on fears of increased costs from...

    Shares of refiners are taking a beating today, apparently on fears of increased costs from proposed tougher standards on gasoline. The EPA is proposing the so-called Tier 3 rules that will require refiners to reduce the sulfur content of gasoline to 10 parts per million by 2017 from 30 ppm. VLO -6.2%, TSO -3.5%, MPC -4.3%, ALJ -4.5%, PSX -3.1%, HFC -3.2%, WNR -4.8%, NTI -5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 39 Comments
  • SEII

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT -5.3%) takes a hit after reporting preliminary FY12 results. Revenues...

    Cleantech Solutions (CLNT -5.3%) takes a hit after reporting preliminary FY12 results. Revenues came in at approximately $57.2M, compared with approximately $55.6M for 2011, and net income of approximately $4.2M, or $1.58 per share, as compared with net income of approximately $5.8M, or $2.30 per share for 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • SLV

    Silver has slid into a bear market, down ~22% since October and settling -2.5% today at $27.24,...

    Silver has slid into a bear market, down ~22% since October and settling -2.5% today at $27.24, and some analysts say the pain is just beginning. Colin Cieszynski says recent moves reflect a technical breakdown but, similar to selling pressure hitting gold, silver is losing fans as inflation fears fade. iShares Silver Trust (SLV -2.4%) has extended its pattern of stair-step declines, an ominous technical warning.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 19 Comments
  • FDML

    Auto industry stocks perform well after the Big Three automakers (GM, Ford, Chrysler) all report...

    Auto industry stocks perform well after the Big Three automakers (GM, Ford, Chrysler) all report strong sales in the U.S. for March and appear to be motoring full speed ahead with production plans. Auto parts: Federal-Mogul (NASDAQ:FDML) +5.0%, Remy International (NASDAQ:REMY) +4.9%, Accuride (NYSE:ACW) +2.5%, Meritor (NYSE:MTOR) +2.0%. Auto stores: O'Reilly Automotive (NASDAQ:ORLY) +1.8%, AutoZone (NYSE:AZO) +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • CAI

    CAI International (CAP +1.9%) continues a big run after the release from embargo of SA Pro...

    CAI International (CAP +1.9%) continues a big run after the release from embargo of SA Pro author Dane Bowler's bullish article. Beginning with the thesis that growth companies these days tend to be overlooked for those in the same business but paying a dividend, Bowler says the reinvestment of profits into the business should allow CAP to grow market share.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • KMB

    Kimberly-Clark (KMB +1.7%) moves up after saying it's acquired the anesthesia business of...

    Kimberly-Clark (KMB +1.7%) moves up after saying it's acquired the anesthesia business of Life-Tech, a Texas-based medical device manufacturer. The acquisition consists of needles, catheters and accessories associated with peripheral nerve block procedures, and the assets will become part of KMB's Health Care business and added to K-C Health Care's ON-Q family of products.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • CBLI

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +2%) moves up after saying that it and Incuron, a joint venture between...

    Cleveland BioLabs (CBLI +2%) moves up after saying that it and Incuron, a joint venture between the CBLI and Bioprocess Capital Ventures, have received a Notice of Allowance from the FDA for an Investigational New Drug application for CBL0137, a treatment for patients with metastatic or unresectable advanced solid cancers. A Phase 1 dosing trials to evaluate the drug's intravenous administration are currently being finalized with the agency.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI +2%) moves up today after reporting the sale of some non-core assets:...

    Apricus Biosciences (APRI +2%) moves up today after reporting the sale of some non-core assets: Totect, a marketed, injectable treatment for anthracycline extravasation, and NitroMist, an FDA-approved nitrate vasodilator that treats angina pectoris. Financial details of the sale were not disclosed

     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • NAT

    Nordic American Tankers (NAT -10%) takes a dive after pricing its follow-on offering at $9.60...

    Nordic American Tankers (NAT -10%) takes a dive after pricing its follow-on offering at $9.60 per share. Underwriters have the option to purchase 1.46M more shares over the next month. 

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics (IMMU +1.2%) moves up today after saying it's reached a $16.7M settlement through...

    Immunomedics (IMMU +1.2%) moves up today after saying it's reached a $16.7M settlement through securities watchdog FINRA with its former broker Bank of America (NYSE:BAC). The settlement resolves allegations the drug company had made related to investments in auction rate securities, for which it accused BAML of making false representations or omissions.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • MCPIQ

    A day after shares sank to an all-time low, DA Davidson initiates coverage of Molycorp (MCP...

    A day after shares sank to an all-time low, DA Davidson initiates coverage of Molycorp (MCP +2.9%) with a Buy rating and $7 price target. The firm thinks implementation of some unique recycling technologies, the use of lower energy cost processes, and the resource advantage from Mountain Pass should help MCP become the low-cost supplier in the rare-earth industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • KWK

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -9%) gives back some of yesterday's gains after selling a 25% stake...

    Quicksilver Resources (KWK -9%) gives back some of yesterday's gains after selling a 25% stake in its Barnett Shale assets to Tokyo Gas for $485M. Raymond James says KWK received a solid price in the sale, but maintains its Underperform rating, preferring to "wait for more progress on the recapitalization front before getting excited."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 7 Comments
  • HIMX

    A bullish Wedge Partners note leads Himax (HIMX +9.6%) to make new 52-week highs yet again....

    A bullish Wedge Partners note leads Himax (HIMX +9.6%) to make new 52-week highs yet again. Wedge asserts Himax has scored deals with Microsoft, Sony, and Samsung, and thinks the company should beat Q1 estimates. Shares now +133% YTD, thanks in large part to Google Glass hopes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • AMRN

    MKM Partners' Jon LeCroy is reiterating his Buy rating and $12 price target on Amarin (AMRN...

    MKM Partners' Jon LeCroy is reiterating his Buy rating and $12 price target on Amarin (AMRN +1.8%) following last week's solid Vascepa weekly prescription data. LeCroy notes that if the current growth continues, assuming a wholesale cost of $184 per prescription and a prescription under-reporting rate of 22%, that would imply Q1 Vascepa sales of approximately $2.2M and Q2 of around $11M. So, while the consensus estimates still appear to be slightly high, LeCroy thinks that with stocking, they still could be attainable.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • GRMN

    Mercedes-Benz picks Garmin (GRMN +4.5%) to be its "global navigation provider" for future...

    Mercedes-Benz picks Garmin (GRMN +4.5%) to be its "global navigation provider" for future models. Garmin-based infotainment systems supporting voice commands and in-dash displays will be integrated into cars over the next 4 years. No word on whether Garmin's innovative/costly K2 platform, shown off in January at CES, will be used. Regardless, the news is helping Garmin rally after shares closed yesterday near their 52-week low. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 3 Comments
  • DAL

    Airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) take a turn lower after Delta Air Lines (DAL -6.7%) issues a...

    Airline stocks (NYSEARCA:FAA) take a turn lower after Delta Air Lines (DAL -6.7%) issues a disappointing report on March traffic. The carrier blamed the sequester and some temporary tech issues for a loss in late bookings, but investors don't seem to buying the excuses. As the first carrier to report March numbers, what Delta says carries some weight. Decliners: LCC -5.3%, ALK -4.6%, UAL -4.4%, LUV -3.7%, JBLU -3.2%, ALGT -1.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM | 6 Comments
  • UNH

    Goldman Sachs opts to remain selective on a few names in the managed care sector following...

    Goldman Sachs opts to remain selective on a few names in the managed care sector following yesterday's announcement by the CMS that Medicaid Advantage rates were going higher. It's reiterating a CL-Buy on UnitedHealth (UNH +7.6%), calling its valuation under 10X FY14 EPS attractive, as well a Buy on Health Net (HNT +3.6%) and WellCare (WCG +5.2%). It maintains Sell ratings on Humana (HUM +8.3%) and Universal American (UAM +9.9%) however, noting the majority of their earnings are tied to Medicaid Advantage with about half of those members in non-HMO plans."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • HTZ

    Hertz Global (HTZ +5.4%) races higher as its Investor Day starts off with a nice boost in...

    Hertz Global (HTZ +5.4%) races higher as its Investor Day starts off with a nice boost in guidance. The information is coming fast and furious from the company but a projection of free cash flow of $550M for 2013 and a 2015 revenue growth target of 12.5% to 13.5% looks juicy to investors. In their presentation, execs pitch the case that the market is undervaluing Hertz by 40% based on historic multiples. (webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 1 Comment
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -6.9%) "has a largely unproven business model, a wide ranging global business mix...

    Groupon (GRPN -6.9%) "has a largely unproven business model, a wide ranging global business mix in transformation, and is undergoing a management change," writes UBS' Eric Sheridan. The daily deals leader is the only company given a Sell rating in a coverage launch for Internet stocks. Google (GOOG +0.6%), eBay (EBAY +1.1%), Yahoo (YHOO +1.2%), AOL (AOL +0.7%), Yelp (YELP +2.4%), and InterActiveCorp (IACI +2.1%) have been started at Buy, and Amazon (AMZN +0.4%), Facebook (FB +1.3%), LinkedIn (LNKD -0.2%), and Zynga (ZNGA +0.3%) at Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • HTZ

    Hertz Global (HTZ +6.6%) and Avis Budget (CAR +5.7%) are both sharply higher in morning trading...

    Hertz Global (HTZ +6.6%) and Avis Budget (CAR +5.7%) are both sharply higher in morning trading after Hertz projects 2015 EPS of $3.10-3.30 a share — analysts were predicting $2.39. 

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • RAX

    A downgrade to Sector Perform from Wells Fargo leads Rackspace (RAX -3%) to fall below $48....

    A downgrade to Sector Perform from Wells Fargo leads Rackspace (RAX -3%) to fall below $48. "While we continue to believe that RAX is a great company ... we think the company is in a transition period which could limit stock appreciation ... for the next 6-12 months," writes analyst Gray Powell. He's worried about Rackspace's price cuts, and the cannibalizing effect cloud infrastructure services could have on hosting services growth. CLSA started coverage with an Underperform last week, and Pac Crest cut shares to Sector Perform the week before.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI +2.2%) nears its 52-week high again after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and...

    Activision (ATVI +2.2%) nears its 52-week high again after UBS starts coverage with a Buy and $17 PT. Archrival Electronic Arts (EA -0.1%) has been started at Neutral.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • OPTR

    Optimer Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OPTR) surges 18.1% following a report that the antibiotics maker...

    Optimer Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:OPTR) surges 18.1% following a report that the antibiotics maker has attracted takeover interest from GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK), AstraZeneca (NYSE:AZN), Cubist Pharmaceuticals (CBST) and Japan's Astellas. Optimer hopes to fetch up to $1B in an auction, well above its market cap of $660M. The company has one drug on the market, Dificid, which is used to treat intestinal infections in hospitalized patients.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM | 1 Comment
  • SES

    Shares of Synthesis Energy Systems (SYMX +30.2%) skyrocket after the company reaches agreement...

    Shares of Synthesis Energy Systems (SYMX +30.2%) skyrocket after the company reaches agreement with a General Electric (NYSE:GE) unit to jointly evaluate and market a small scale power generation unit combining SYMX's gasification technology with GE's aeroderivative gas turbines.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • FFIV

    Baird upgrades F5 (FFIV +2%) to Outperform, citing optimism about both the company's core...

    Baird upgrades F5 (FFIV +2%) to Outperform, citing optimism about both the company's core business (application delivery controllers) and its efforts to expand into security hardware. McAdams Wright made similar arguments while upgrading F5 last week. Shares are still -8% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 1 Comment
  • AFFY

    More on Affymax (OTC:AFFY -8.1%) Q4: net loss more than doubles to $68.3M as company takes a...

    More on Affymax (OTC:AFFY -8.1%) Q4: net loss more than doubles to $68.3M as company takes a $45M charge related to the recall of its anti-anemia Omontys drug due to safety concerns. Affymax warns that because of the recall, its ability to continue operations is in doubt. The firm is evaluating various alternatives, including a sale, further restructuring, winding down its ops and bankruptcy proceedings. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • NDAQ

    Nasdaq OMX (NDAQ -7.2%) slides after last night's eSpeed acquisition announcement and subsequent...

    Nasdaq OMX (NDAQ -7.2%) slides after last night's eSpeed acquisition announcement and subsequent credit rating downgrade. The sell side gives a thumbs down, with Goldman and Jefferies saying a slowdown in share repurchases could weigh on the stock, BMO proclaiming itself not sold on the deal, and Evercore downgrading to Hold.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM

  • Market preview: Shares look set to rebound from yesterday's losses, with futures tracking...

    Market preview: Shares look set to rebound from yesterday's losses, with futures tracking European equities higher despite some fairly dismal eurozone factory data. The S&P Mini is +0.4% at 1,562.5, putting the main index within distance of its all-time intra-day peak of 1,576.09. Health insurers gain on news of a planned increase in Medicare Advantage rates, while Vodafone is +4.8% following a report that AT&T (+0.3%) and Verizon are plotting a $245B break-up merger.
